sub_title: Managing Director at KVE Composites (a Daher Company)
summary:
“Self-starting manufacturing and innovation ecosystem specialist with international aerospace exposure and hands-on experience with design, industrialization, and certification of innovative manufacturing systems, production lines and research facilities: Professional, loyal, enthusiastic, multidisciplinary and persistent.

Comfortable at all levels of the organization and the linking pin between management, engineering, production, quality assurance, innovation and academia. Experienced in assuring that the 'digital' side of manufacturing stays in touch with the 'physical' reality of manufacturing. Implementing organizational changes to embed innovative technology. A ‘system thinker’ in the broader innovation ecosystem covering material science, manufacturing, automation and organization.

My achievements underline my ambition to be a respected leader in establishing and improving advanced manufacturing environments in such way that all that are involved can reap the rewards of well-executed complex team work, irrespective of background or level of education: "Excellence, challenge and purpose go hand-in-hand”

courses.name: Oral Presentation Course, Technical Report Writing Course

profile_positions.description: KVE is a unique design and build organization of high-end composite structures located in the Netherlands, supported by a well-established parent company Daher Aerospace. KVE’s strength is the in-depth knowledge of composite engineering, materials and manufacturing processes, in combination with a creative mind to provide the right solutions for its customers.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
SAM|XL is a collaborative industry4.0 technology development and test center at the Delft University of Technology where the European aerospace industry and knowledge institutes jointly develop, demonstrate and de-risk manufacturing solutions by combining material science, robotics and AI. 
	I was responsible for the establishment of SAM|XL from scratch: Preparation of the 2000m2 industrial scale facility; Shaping, acquisition and realisation of the shared robotic infrastructure involving cobots, industrial robots and a large gantry robot system for parts manufacture, assembly and inspection; Building of a multidisciplinary technical team of engineers and PhDs to establish the infrastructure and to execute collaborative projects with industry; Daily centre management, project design, funding acquisition and development of a dedicated business/IP model. 
	Furthermore, I lead the development of a shared innovation vision in which artificial intelligence enables robotic processes to compensate for variations in the manufacturing processes without manual programming: This enables industrial robots to play an active role, alongside the qualified manual workforce, in the quality assured manufacture of certified components: one-offs part, first time right and certified at once.
profile_positions.title: CEO/CTO

profile_positions.description:
TCG was established to coordinate and kick-start activities to enhance the advanced manufacturing ecosystem of South Africa through public-private collaboration, with special focus on the aerospace and composites sectors.  
	Responsible for shaping and hands-on managing the establishment of two composite innovations centres (CICs) at universities in Pretoria and Port Elizabeth with advanced manufacturing and test equipment for education and research purposes; establishment and management of the Mandela Bay Composites Cluster (MBCC) to rally the aerospace, maritime, and automotive manufacturing industry around these CICs for collaborative innovation and workforce training.
	Lead the development of technology roadmaps and implementation strategies for the aerospace, composites and biomaterials industry of South Africa; Guided various government departments with techno-economic analyses, value-chain mapping and the implementation of the national R&D tax incentive; Continued to support the manufacturing industry with innovation, certification and qualification efforts.
profile_positions.title: Technical Director

profile_positions.description:
Aerosud is the most reputable supplier of aerostructure components in Africa, employing over 600 people that specialize in the design and manufacture of metallic, plastic and composite parts for all the major OEMs. I played a leading role in transitioning Aerosud from metallic into composite technology across all layers of the organisation. Furthermore, I was responsible for the establishment and industrialization of two production lines, including training and technology transfer from the Innovation & Training Centre:
I. Airbus A350 thermoplastic composite frame clips: Played a pivotal role in snatching the contract away from more established thermoplastic composite manufacturers in Europe and the USA; Provided material and manufacturability input to the customer; Devised the overall manufacturing concept including waterjet, press-forming, CNC, edge sealing, CMM and NDT; Specified, designed, and qualified an automated 100-tons thermoplastic composite press-forming cell in less than 6 months, including tooling concept; Industrialized over 250 P/Ns for an overall production rate of >3000 parts per month. Leading a small team of self-trained engineering specialists to assure alignment between all technical and non-technical departments that are involved in preparing and executing production; Preparing "work instructions” and inspection criteria; Leading role in audits and “first articles”.
II. Airbus A400M thermoplastic composite cargo-liner: Devised the press-forming cycle including tooling concept for large (1x2m) double curved panels; Specified an automated 600-tons composite press-forming cell (one of the largest in existence), including support in the design and qualification phase; Process development and qualification for various adhesive bonding and coating operations.
III. Various aircraft interior programs (several OEMs and airlines):  Continuous improvement, troubleshooting and root-cause analysis activities in both lead and support roles.
profile_positions.title: Lead Manufacturing Engineer

profile_positions.description:
The Aerosud Innovation & Training Centre (ITC) develops innovative technology for the Aerosud Aviation manufacturing company in collaboration with universities and research institutes, including structural composites, additive manufacturing & metrology.
	At the ITC, I was involved in strategizing the overall direction of the centre with a specific responsibility for the establishment of the composites research lab, the composite research projects and training of Aerosud’s next generation composite engineers. Daily management of a team of 6 research engineers who participated in various innovation and continuous improvements projects at Aerosud Aviation. Manufacturing concept development for various composite parts for the Airbus A400M, A350 and A380 aircraft programs, including composite fairings and wing covers for the in-house developed two-seater AHRLAC reconnaissance aircraft.
profile_positions.title: Composites Expert

profile_positions.description: International project on development of natural fibre based composite technology, including material development & characterization, processing and prototype development. The project was done in collaboration with the Hanoi University of Technology (Hanoi, Vietnam) with a focus on knowledge transfer and the establishment of a research lab. I was responsible for international relations, project design, management, technical execution and funding acquisition.
profile_positions.title: International Project Engineer

profile_positions.description: I lectured ‘Static and Dynamic Mechanics’ as a student teacher to 1st and 2nd year students and assisted them with their assignments, which formed part of this course. In addition, I supervised several groups (3rd year students) during aircraft related design exercises.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant

company.name: Composites Industry Association of South Africa

volunteer_experiences.description: Established an informal industry body to unite the cross-sectoral composites industry in South Africa. The aim is to create a collective voice and raise awareness for the advanced manufacturing sector.
